Promotion and Publicity
Woefully little has been done in the way of promotion.
It is the fondest hope of the network headquarters that this phase
of the operation will be vastly implemented with the arrival of
funds.
There are so many possibilities that only a few will be
mentioned. As indicated earlier we would like to make greater use
of the NAEB News-Letter. We would like to send releases to newspapers
in all of the cities where NAEB stations are located. We would like
to get some stories in National periodicals. We would like to send
literature to schools, listener councils, and other organizations that
might be interested in high calibre programming. We have hopes, too,
of helping the stations in every possible way to promote these programs.
This will be easier when the stations can reasonably depend on the
network schedule.
